resource.chars:
‘Discovery’
Cape Crozier 
Jany 22nd 1902 
To be forwarded to 
The Secretary 
National Antarctic Expedition 
University Building 
Burlington Gardens 
London W 
For the information of the Presidents of the Royal &
Royal Geographical Societies of England 
Sirs 
I have the honour to inform you that I left 
records of our voyage at Cape Adare, in the 
hut left by Mr Borchgrevink and at Coulman 
Island, on a pole painted red & secured to a 
rock in the cove immediately north of Cape 
Wadworth 
These records briefly state the circumstances of 
our voyage up to Jan 14th 
It will be seen that we penetrated the main 
pack without difficulty and continued our 
voyage down the coast of Victoria land 
against an adverse wind, finally being delayed 
nearly three days under the Shelter of Coulman 
Island by a heavy gale 
Since that time we have enjoyed magnificently 
fine weather and have been able to trace
